La pena de este juego es que al morir tantisímas veces cuando somos noobs, la mayor parte de ellos acaban por dejar de jugarlo. Esto mismo me pasó a mi, hasta que volví y me acostumbré. Es un juegazo, muy divertido, siendo realmente dos juegos con modalidades totalmente distintas, personajes icónicos, ademas de la posibilidad de partidas privadas para matar a tus amigo, o también tienes la posibilidad de jugar con ellos como supervivientes. Súper recomendado, pero lo dicho, no desistas al principio, todo es practica. Busca guías.

Le jeu est bourré de bug, 15 minutes pour trouvé une partie (que ce soit tueur ou survivant) et les tueurs / compétences n'ont absolument aucun équilibrage.
C'est dommage car le jeu est intéressant et pourrais être mille fois mieux si les développeur s'occuperais de régler les problème de leur jeu plutôt qu'a vendre des DLC et des skins.
Je recommande quand même le jeu car même si il est  actuellement dégueulasse je me suis bien amusé dessus, et qui c'est peux-être que dans 1 ans les dév aurons compris qu'il faut se bouger.

DBD is a great game in concept.  Asymmetrical player versus player is a great dynamic.  The problems this game has are balance and toxicity. Balance changes tend to be very reactive and not gradual, and based on data points collected by the developers that do not take into account a myriad of other factors.  Killer versus survivor interactions tend to be toxic on both sides.  Additionally, the developers refuse to address things like voice comms giving survivors a significant advantage.  Rather than addressing this by balancing or changing the game to make voice comms invalid, or to integrate voice comms in a way that is balanced and works with the killer dynamic, they simply ignore it.  All of this breeds disdain and toxicity between the two sides.
I have hopes that the game will become what much of the community thinks it can and should be, but if you're looking to buy this game, go in with eyes open, thick skin, and a fireproof suit, no matter which side you play.

The finest in asymmetrical multiplayer gaming.

You can pick from two roles:  killer, or survivor.  As the killer, you chase four survivors around the map, trying to sacrifice them all before they can escape.  As a survivor, repair generators to power exit gates, and then activate those gates to escape.

Survivors cannot permanently damage the killer.  In a lot of 4v1 games, the 4 are actively hunting the 1, or the 1 is a (much) more powerful version of the 4.  Not so here.  In the true spirit of horror movies, the killer cannot be stopped, only escaped.

Both roles are harder than you'd think.  As a newbie killer, all four survivors will escape many times.  As a newbie survivor, you will die a lot (and it will be terrifying).  But you'll get better with practice.  A lot of practice.  (The terror never really goes away, though.  At least not entirely.)

Good for fans of difficult asymmetrical multiplayer games and horror movie fans.  Lots of killers and survivors to choose from, some with movie IPs (Freddy, Michael Myers, etc.) all with slightly different "perks" to earn.  That and occasional events provide for a lot of replayability.
It's fun but is even more fun when playing with friends and co-operating!

Can't recommend unless you find it for $5-$10. 

The game is one mode - be a survivor and turn on generators or be a killer and kill the survivors.  It's fun for the first hour.  Gets repetitive fast.

DEAD GAME

Eigentlich ein gutes Spiel mit ner coolen Idee. Trotz der Brutalität ist es nicht ein einfaches Killer Spiel, sondern kann auch strategisch und emotional werden.

Obwohl ich es seid mehr als 425 Stunden gespielt habe kann ich es nicht wirklich empfehlen.

1. Für Neueinsteiger ist es sehr schwierig hinein zu kommen, da es sehr viele verschiedene Killer, Perks und Fähigkeiten gibt.
Eine generelle Übersicht gibt es zwar schon, jedoch hat keiner Lust sich alle Sachen durchzulesen bevor er überhaupt weis ob ihm das Spiel gefallen wird.

2. Bugs... oh ja, jede menga davon...
Oft wird das Spielerlebniss einfach von den Bugs zerstört. Ob man jetzt "Dead Hard" verwendet, und im selben moment trotzdem vom Killer getroffen wird, Instand Healing nicht funktioniert obwohl es verbraucht wurde, oder jede menge andere Dinge. Es gibt so viele Bugs das man diese garnicht alle aufzählen könnte. 

3. Connection & Spielersuche
Angeblich sollte dies mit den Servern besser werden, sieht meiner Meinung jedoch nicht so aus. Trotz eines angeblichen 50 Ping, wird man trotzdem oft getroffen obwohl man bereits hinter dem Hinderniss ist,...
Auch bei der Spielersuche müsste einiges gemacht werden...
Als Killer sucht man 10 Minuten nach Überlebenden, damit die Lobby dann abgebrochen wird weil jemand wähhrend des Ladens die Verbindung abgebrochen hat, und als Überlebenden erhält man manchmal Full Lobbys ohne Killer und wartet dafür trotzdem mal eine Minute.
Macht meiner Meinung nach keinen Sinn...

Es gibt hier noch eine Menge die man reinschreiben könnte, ich bin jedoch Faul
Medor

well...random clicked recommend and then this popped up...so lets give you a short review:

4 survivors vs 1 killer ; survivors need to repair 5generators to power the exit gates to be able to open them and escape ; survivors die when they get hooked the 3rd time, the killer can hit them (2x with normal attacks) to down them and get em hooked. the killer cant die!
as simple as that...in a nutshell...there are "skill-checks" for the gens, a hatch and a cooldown for the killer-hit and so on, but i dont wanna go for that in detail to keep this short.

i got 2 dislikes right off the bat
the biggest dislike is the waiting time when playing a killer!
another one is that you cant communicate with other survivors (besides 2 emotes:pointing out and a "come" gesture), i see that this affects the game drastically gameplaywise and they thought this out...but i would love a voicechat with a range like in the game "friday the 13th". the fact that the killer can hear them too makes it kinda fair, cause some guys are just so confused, its kinda unbearable sometimes! this would nevertheless be a great opportunity (but already hearing kids yelling via voicechat) for survivors, but if you play against a mid-skilled or higher killer, there is no chance all 4 will make it out alive and this would even that point.
anyways, the dumb will be punished with death and less survivors means its harder and trickier to get out.
sometimes thats what it takes to make it a good competition!

they add content regularly so u can constantly change/upgrade your playstyle in anyway that fits you, you can unlock perks of one character for all others so as survivor in lategame its just about cosmetics which character you play if you aready unlocked the perks you wanna play with. but as the killer you got an unique skill which is basically a special hit or a boost for your normal hits.
there are so many perks, perks for nearly everything one can think of (and as said regularly new content), so its up to you!

sooo if you are into the excitement of hide and seek pared with getting chased horror movie style
OR into being the killer and hunt your prey down to decide who will get out alive (...or will no one?)
everything forged with a good mix of customization options to fit your playstyle, as both sides,
then come and join in, maybe i rescue you next time... or slice you with my blades =)

Even after 3 and a half years, the devs still don't fix major glitched and bugs. Everytime they release an update, some element in the game breaks, and makes the game unplayable until they fix it. When the game has been out for over 3 years, you would think they knew how to make an update, without destroying the game at the same time.... but no. With the recent update adding Oni to the game, any survivor hooked in the basement have their screen go all grey and you can't see anything for the rest of that match, plus you can't struggle at all... the option just isn't there atm. 3 YEARS, and this sh1t is still a mess.

Edit: The game still sucks so f*ing hard. Glitches every single match, and the game is extremely killer sided. Unless you have 3 friends to play with, you can't win. Statistics released by the devs themselves, show that killers sacrifice A LOT more players than survivors manage to escape. The game is just not fun!!!

1. Бан - это честь, для каждого из нас, ибо путь воина (Пауля) это стремление к Бану. Воин открывает для себя смысл бытия через познание Бана. Воин должен помнить о Бане, и делать все как в последний раз. © Философия Бусидо
2. Вы не сможете быть забаненными на канале, если будете не достаточно токсичными.
3. Бан - это не конец, это лишь отправная точка к разбану и череде новых банов.
4. Прошарится - значит приблизиться к бану на один шаг в бесконечном пути к нему.
5. Бан - это как Инь и Янь, может быть как и даром от стримера верному зрителю так и наказанием для неверных.
6. Ведь никто же не знает ни того, что такое Бан, ни того, не есть ли это для человека величайшим из благ, а все боятся Бана, как будто знают наверняка, что это есть величайшим из зол. Но не самое ли это позорное невежество — думать, что знаешь то, чего не знаешь... © Платон (Апология Сократа)

Other people can tell you how fun the game is. I would just point out how involved the developers are. They work tirelessly to bring us new chapters, balance the game and fix bugs. The game is quite bug-prone no one is denying that. You see, Dead by Daylight isn't an FPS, and there are very few games like it, so no one really knows exactly what would work for the game. So the developers actively listen to the community. They put out public test builds, conduct public experiments and surveys, and are generally very active on social media. They listen to us when the game seems broken, like when some perk seems unbalanced, or some part of the map is one-sided. And based on all this feedback, they have managed to delicately balance DBD so that it may be fun for both killers and survivors. And it just keeps on improving. So yeah, I really think they did a ... PRETTY GOOD JOB SO FAR!  XD
класс

To keep it simple, this game is absolutely worth it. I got this game because it was on sale and convinced a couple friends to get it as well, we started off playing SWF to learn, i quickly became hooked and kept playing solo. Playing killer or survivor, you cant go wrong. The largest con about this game is the nagging and moaning that comes from the opposite team. If you are killer, survivors moan, if you are survivor, killers moan. Its a never ending cycle. But it seems to come with the territory of having an objective to beat the other side. Still a 10/10 game for its price.
Having a great time with the game. My only con is that I'm having trouble finding matches here and there, but other than that it's great.
